message:
OneNote for PC is now free. This is big!!

Read about how we we use OneNote in Readify here:
http://gurustop.net/blog/2014/03/05/using-onenote-as-wikis-inside-readify/

And Hanselman has a good writing on OneNote APIs & SDKs here:
http://www.hanselman.com/blog/OneNoteAndMicrosoftsQuietAPIRevolution.aspx
name: Microsoft OneNote | The digital note-taking app for your devices
caption: www.onenote.com
description: Get the OneNote app for free on your tablet, phone, and computer, so you can capture your ideas and to-do lists in one place wherever you are. Or try OneNote with Office for free.

data.message: The Windows Store version of OneNote was already free, but it's nice that they did the same with the desktop app too :)
The website says "Get OneNote free on all your devices", not just the desktop version
A lot of people like OneNote, even OSS hardcore programmers who hate Microsoft :)
As Hassan said, OneNote was free for several devices already. The additional is the full original OneNote.
And Yes, OneNote can be the gate to some very interesting opportunities as outlined in http://gurustop.net/blog/2014/03/05/using-onenote-as-wikis-inside-readify/
